title: Ticket #6701: condor_off -peaceful disrespects max job length
description:
Snippets from the StartLog: 

06/11/18 09:38:26 (D_ALWAYS) Got SIGTERM. Performing graceful shutdown.
06/11/18 09:38:26 (D_ALWAYS) shutdown graceful
...
06/11/18 09:38:26 (D_ALWAYS) slot2: Changing activity: Busy -> Retiring
06/11/18 09:38:26 (D_ALWAYS) slot4: Changing activity: Busy -> Retiring
06/11/18 09:38:26 (D_ALWAYS) slot3: Changing activity: Busy -> Retiring
06/11/18 09:38:26 (D_ALWAYS) slot1: Changing activity: Busy -> Retiring
...
06/12/18 10:06:51 (D_ALWAYS) slot2: Changing state and activity: Claimed/Retiring -> Preempting/Vacating
06/12/18 10:06:55 (D_ALWAYS) slot2: State change: starter exited
06/12/18 10:06:55 (D_ALWAYS) slot2: State change: No preempting claim, returning to owner
06/12/18 10:06:55 (D_ALWAYS) slot2: Changing state and activity: Preempting/Vacating -> Owner/Idle
06/12/18 10:06:55 (D_ALWAYS) slot2: State change: IS_OWNER is false
06/12/18 10:06:55 (D_ALWAYS) slot2: Changing state: Owner -> Unclaimed
...
06/12/18 15:39:25 (D_ALWAYS) slot1: State change: PREEMPT is TRUE
...
06/12/18 15:41:45 (D_ALWAYS) slot4: Changing state and activity: Claimed/Retiring -> Preempting/Vacating
06/12/18 15:41:48 (D_ALWAYS) slot4: State change: starter exited
06/12/18 15:41:48 (D_ALWAYS) slot4: State change: No preempting claim, returning to owner
06/12/18 15:41:48 (D_ALWAYS) slot4: Changing state and activity: Preempting/Vacating -> Owner/Idle
06/12/18 15:41:48 (D_ALWAYS) slot4: State change: IS_OWNER is false
06/12/18 15:41:48 (D_ALWAYS) slot4: Changing state: Owner -> Unclaimed
...
06/12/18 16:12:14 (D_ALWAYS) slot3: State change: PREEMPT is TRUE
...

Note that slot1 and slot3 are never actually preempted, leaving us with the following state: 

[tlmiller@gitter0000 ~]$ date
Thu Jun 14 10:45:45 CDT 2018
[tlmiller@gitter0000 ~]$ condor_status gitter0000.chtc.wisc.edu -af Name State Activity 'formatTime(EnteredCurrentActivity)'
slot1@gitter0000.chtc.wisc.edu Claimed Retiring Mon Jun 11 09:38:26 2018
slot2@gitter0000.chtc.wisc.edu Unclaimed Idle Tue Jun 12 10:06:55 2018
slot3@gitter0000.chtc.wisc.edu Claimed Retiring Mon Jun 11 09:38:26 2018
slot4@gitter0000.chtc.wisc.edu Unclaimed Idle Tue Jun 12 15:41:48 2018
remarks:
2018-Jun-14 11:00:01 by tlmiller:
In condor_startd.V6/Resource.cpp, line 455, (called shortly after we print the state change line), we deliberately don't check the max job retirement time if we're in a peaceful shutdown.

This is another manifestation of #6664 or #6697, where the proper solution is probably splitting PREEMPT into PREEMPT and EVICT, the latter of which does not respect MJRT.

In this particular example, it's immediately obvious if we should change Resource::retire_claim() or the code calling it in ResState::eval(). (It would be a hack to have the startd compute the max job retirement time for individual jobs while their slot is retiring for the purpose of terminating them if the value ever happened to become 0.)

2018-Jun-14 11:31:44 by tlmiller:
Making a child of #6697 since we'll be resolving #6664 for 8.7.9, as the breakage there is no worse than it has been.

2018-Jul-16 13:05:03 by tim:
This will be resolved by code changes for #6697
